WorkItem.Description: Would it be possible to model a cycle with scorch, living bomb, pyroblast and fire blast on cooldown? This would possibly be interesting for movement fights and when specced for improved fire blast. Thanks.
WorkItem.Summary: [Feature Request.Mage] Scorch Rotation with Fire Blast

Comments.Message: Well currently I don't have any real support for movement cycles (currently all the movement parameters are interpreted as out of range to in range movement where you can't attack at all) so it would make more sense to first create support for real inrange movement.
What if it were also possibly better dps/dpm than a regular scorch cycle, ie. in the upcoming patch where fireball has a lower cost?
That could be possible, I'd need to do dpm conversion analysis of those cycles to see which ones are optimal.

I don't mean to be pushy Kavan, but I'm not sure it's a feature request. Rathe101 on EJ posted a link to a spreadsheet which shows it's a dps increase, and that dpm is low enough that it may be an optimal low-mana cycle even without the movement. Unfortunately he's unable to do the math that Rawr.mage does in the solver, so he can't prove it. 

You can see his spreadsheets here. He's simplified the rotation to just assume 4 scorches for every 1 fireblast.
https://spreadsheets.google.com/ccc?key=0AiCFsKWjNGYgdEQ5UU91d2xWQkN0SmVkWW5CLU5NcGc&hl=en&authkey=CKWz6b0C#gid=0
